creator: david_syer@hotmail.com
text: There are two dependencies (both optional, but nice to have for users to see what they might need), both do not exist.  There are spelling errors (emmed->embed) in the artifractId and the groupId is also wrong (*.tomcat.embed->*.tomcat).

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
The one typo I could find has been fixed in the source (r881735).

I believe the group IDs are correct and that both dependencies exist in the correct locations for those IDs. See:
http://people.apache.org/repo/m2-snapshot-repository/org/apache/tomcat/embed/

I don't know Maven that well, so if this needs tweaking please provide exact details as to what is required (ideally a patch) and an explanation of why it is required.

I'll update the files on people.a.o once all of these issues have been resolved.

I see those artifacts in the repository.  There's a spelling error there as well ("tomcta-embed-logging-juli").  The original problem is in the POM for tomcat-embed-core (the groupId is correct here, but incorrect in the repository itself, and the artifactId is wrong - maybe that's what you fixed?):

{code}
...
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.tomcat.embed</groupId>
      <artifactId>tomcat-emmed-logging-juli</artifactId>
...
    </dependency>
...
{code}
creator: david_syer@hotmail.com
markt@apache.org
text:
Found them. Fixed in svn.

I'll update the snapshot repository shortly.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
I found a couple more typos which have been fixed. The snapshots have now been updated. I have removed the directories associated with the mis-typed artifact IDs.

Since the snapshot is from trunk, the usual warnings apply. If you find any issues, please raise additional bugs against Tomcat 7.

As an aside, is it safe to remove the old snapshots or should I leave them in case folks want to build against the older snapshot (particularly if the current snapshot has a regression)?
